source.description: Sustainable Development Goal 2 (Zero Hunger) indicators from UN Statistics Division.

source_context: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Framework

goal.name: Zero Hunger
goal.full_title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
goal.description: Goal 2 seeks to end hunger and all forms of malnutrition by 2030. It commits to universal access to safe, nutritious and sufficient food, and to double agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers.

targets.text: By 2030, end hunger and ensure access by all people to safe, nutritious and sufficient food all year round
By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age
By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers
By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices
Maintain genetic diversity of seeds, cultivated plants, farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species

metrics.ind_2_1_2: Prevalence of moderate or severe food insecurity in the population (%)
metrics.ind_2_3_1: Productivity of small-scale food producers (agricultural output per labour day, PPP) (constant 2017 international $)
metrics.ind_2_3_2: Average income of small-scale food producers, PPP (constant 2017 international $)
metrics.ind_2_4_1: [PROXY] Progress toward productive and sustainable agriculture, current status score
metrics.ind_2_5_1: Number of transboundary breeds (including extinct ones)
metrics.ind_2_a_1: Agriculture value added share of GDP (%)
metrics.ind_2_a_2: Total official flows (disbursements) for agriculture, by recipient countries (millions of constant 2023 United States do
metrics.ind_2_b_1: Agricultural export subsidies (millions of current United States dollars)
metrics.ind_2_c_1: Indicator of Food Price Anomalies (IFPA), by Consumer Food Price Index
